bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, January 29, 1941

div1.p: Hench asks for any available copies of the brochure "A Mile Post" and/or Alumni Bulletins, from Washington and Jefferson College. Hench questions a request for his biographical data from Washington and Jefferson College officials since he assumes they have it already on file.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Ralph Cooper Hutchison, January 29, 1941
div1.p:
Can't you send me any copies of “A Mile
Post” or Alumni Bulletins at all? If not, I will be very
sorry, but I hardly think that you should make a special
printing of it. I will just have to wait until I can have
it reprinted here or elsewhere.

If you could send me a few of each, it
would help greatly. Be sure to send Mrs. Lazear the plate, and
send me the bill.

Buddy Groves spent Monday here, from morning
till night. Having been brought up to believe that South
Dakota is a financial flop, I can't enthuse about his accepting
the job in Huron, but the more we talked to him, the more de-
termined he seemed to be to accept.

By the way, I just received a form letter
sent out to all the alumni, asking for biographical data. I
imagine that I am to ignore this. Am I correct?
div1.closer: Always sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
